verses.verse: "What <S%H4100><s%> a help <S%H5826><s%> you are to the weak <S%H3808><s%>! <S%H3581><s%> How you have saved <S%H3467><s%> the arm <S%H2220><s%> without <S%H3808><s%> strength! <S%H5797><s%>

"What <S%H4100><s%> counsel <S%H3289><s%> you have given <S%H3289><s%> to [one] without <S%H3808><s%> wisdom! <S%H2451><s%> What helpful <S%H8454><s%> insight <S%H8454><s%> you have abundantly <S%H7230><s%> provided! <S%H3045><s%>
"To whom <S%H4310><s%> have you uttered <S%H5046><s%> words <S%H4405><s%>? And whose <S%H4310><s%> spirit <S%H5397><s%> was expressed <S%H3318><s%> through <S%H4480><s%> you?
"The departed <S%H7496><s%> spirits <S%H7496><s%> tremble <S%H9123><s%> Under <S%H8478><s%> the waters <S%H4325><s%> and their inhabitants. <S%H7931><s%>
"Naked <S%H6174><s%> is Sheol <S%H7585><s%> before <S%H5048><s%> Him And Abaddon <S%H11><s%> has <S%H369><s%> no <S%H369><s%> covering. <S%H3682><s%>
"He stretches <S%H5186><s%> out the north <S%H6828><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> empty <S%H8414><s%> space, <S%H8414><s%> And hangs <S%H8518><s%> the earth <S%H776><s%> on nothing. <S%H1099><s%>
"He wraps <S%H9503><s%> up the waters <S%H4325><s%> in His clouds; <S%H5645><s%> And the cloud <S%H6051><s%> does not burst <S%H1234><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> them.
"He obscures <S%H270><s%> the face <S%H6440><s%> of the full <S%H3677><s%> moon, <S%H3677><s%> And spreads <S%H6576><s%> His cloud <S%H6051><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> it.
"He has inscribed <S%H2328><s%> a circle <S%H2328><s%> on the surface <S%H6440><s%> of the waters, <S%H4325><s%> At the boundary <S%H8503><s%> of light <S%H216><s%> and darkness. <S%H2822><s%>
"The pillars <S%H5982><s%> of heaven <S%H8064><s%> tremble, <S%H9573><s%> And are amazed <S%H8539><s%> at His rebuke. <S%H1606><s%>
"He quieted <S%H9541><s%> the sea <S%H3220><s%> with His power, <S%H3581><s%> And by His understanding <S%H8394><s%> He shattered <S%H4272><s%> Rahab. <S%H7293><s%>
"By His breath <S%H7307><s%> the heavens <S%H8064><s%> are cleared; <S%H8235><s%> His hand <S%H3027><s%> has pierced <S%H9135><s%> the fleeing <S%H1281><s%> serpent. <S%H5175><s%>

"Behold, <S%H2005><s%> these <S%H428><s%> are the fringes <S%H7098><s%> of His ways; <S%H1870><s%> And how <S%H4100><s%> faint <S%H8102><s%> a word <S%H1697><s%> we hear <S%H8085><s%> of Him! But His mighty <S%H1369><s%> thunder, <S%H7482><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> can understand <S%H995><s%>?"
